subject: Negotiation
title: Algorithms of Persuasion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Algorithms of Persuasion usable.

buildup.text: Algorithms select content that keeps you engaged â€” which means content that triggers strong emotions.

discovery.text: This creates filter bubbles where you only see information that confirms what you already believe.

twist.text: Algorithms don't persuade directly. They curate the environment that shapes your beliefs over time.

climax.text: Understanding algorithmic influence is essential for anyone negotiating in a world shaped by digital media.

punchline.text: The most powerful persuader is the one you don't notice.

quiz.question: How do algorithms influence beliefs?
